FuncDef: The issu reset rollback-timer command is used to change the value of the ISSU rollback timer.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the value of the rollback timer, in minutes. For example, if time is set to 10, rollback will be performed 10 minutes after the command execution.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 2880, in minutes. The default value is 120.

Sets the value of the rollback timer to infinite long. That is, rollback to the old version will not be performed before the execution of the issu abort or issu confirm command.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
During an ISSU, the issu reset rollback-timer command can be used to change the value of the rollback timer.
You can use the display issu rollback-timer command to view the time left before the rollback timer expires.
Prerequisites
The issu start command with the rollback-timer parameter has been executed.The issu confirm command has not been executed to confirm the ISSU result.

Configuration Impact
The rollback timer of the ISSU starts.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
